bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing memfd_test from 'create' accesses on the file 3.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: SELinux is preventing memfd_test from 'create' accesses on the file 3.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that memfd_test should be allowed create access on the 3 file by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'memfd_test' --raw | audit2allow -M my-memfdtest # semodule -X 300 -i my-memfdtest.pp
Additional Information: Source Context unconfined_u:unconfined_r:unconfined_t:s0-s0:c0.c1 023 Target Context unconfined_u:object_r:unconfined_t:s0 Target Objects 3 [ file ] Source memfd_test Source Path memfd_test Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM <Unknown> Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Enforcing Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.7.4-200.fc24.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Sep 15 18:42:09 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 1 First Seen 2016-09-20 09:51:19 NZST Last Seen 2016-09-20 09:51:19 NZST Local ID 5b469575-60a2-4e62-ad1a-ccd62887f087
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1474321879.752:1278): avc: denied { create } for pid=8164 comm="memfd_test" name="3" scontext=unconfined_u:unconfined_r:unconfined_t:s0-s0:c0.c1023 tcontext=unconfined_u:object_r:unconfined_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=0
Hash: memfd_test,unconfined_t,unconfined_t,file,create
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.7.4-200.fc24.x86_64 type: libreport
